actions.committee: House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs.
Reported to House from the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs with amendment, H. Rept. 95-233.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Measure passed House, amended, roll call #176 (377-14).

actions.committee: Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Reported to Senate from the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources with amendment, S. Rept. 95-144.
Placed on calendar in Senate under Measures Cleared to be Considered by Unanimous Consent.
Measure called up by unanimous consent in Senate.

official_title: An Act to authorize appropriations for continuation of construction of distribution systems and drains on the San Luis Unit, Central Valley project, California, to mandate the extension and review of the project by the Secretary, and for other purposes.

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources with amendment, S. Rept. 95-144) Authorizes appropriations for fiscal year 1978, of $31,050,000, for the continuation of construction of distribution systems and drains on the San Luis Unit, Central Valley Project, California. Empowers the Secretary of the Interior to establish a task force to review the management, organization, and operations of the San Luis Unit, and to submit a report to the Congress. Prohibits the Secretary from approving any amendatory or temporary contract extending more than 180 days beyond December 31, 1977, prior to the completion of the task force report on January 1, 1978, whichever occurs first.

titles.title: A bill to amend the act of June 3, 1960 (74 Stat. 156), authorizing the Secretary of the Interior to construct the San Luis Unit, Central Valley Project, California.

An Act to authorize appropriations for continuation of construction of distribution systems and drains on the San Luis Unit, Central Valley project, California, to mandate the extension and review of the project by the Secretary, and for other purposes.
